byline.contributor: Patrick Healy contributed reporting from Hooksett, and Steve Eder from New York.

abstract: Jeb Bush, in campaign speech in New Hampshire, shares his personal and family struggles in dealing with daughter Noelle's long struggle with drug addiction, which became public when he was Florida governor.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Bush shared the story of his daughter’s struggle with addiction as part of a New Hampshire forum on heroin that included four other Republican presidential candidates.

headline.main: Jeb Bush Drops Guard to Share Family Account of Addiction
headline.print_headline: Bush Drops His Guard to Share a Family Tale of Battling Addiction

snippet: Mr. Bush shared the story of his daughter’s struggle with addiction as part of a New Hampshire forum on heroin that included four other Republican presidential candidates.
